channel.title: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP) :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: The first two sections of the source document are being used in Learn > OIDC > Identity Providers (ID: 784) so this doc starts at “How Okta connects to external IdPs” but requires a new introduction to this group of documents as a whole.

item.title: Add a social IdP
item.description: Add a social IdP Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Links to original docs: Social Login: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/social-login/amazon/main/ Structure type: Task Content type: How-to without code A “How-to without code” illustrates how to perform a specific task that does not rely on writing code. They tend to walk the reader through administrative tasks but not exclusively. They might include code snippets such as API requests and responses, or outline how to develop the required solution but without walking through the majority of the code required to implement it.

item.title: Add an enterprise IdP
item.description: Add an enterprise IdP Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: What is an “Enterprise” IdP. We need to define it and understand whether this is the best way to split up IdPs. Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - To make it more clear, change the dimensions to: - Azure AD to Azure AD IdP - Okta - to Okta -> Okta IdP - Generic OIDC IdP - Generic SAML 2.

item.title: Add the Login.gov IdP
item.description: Add the Login.gov IdP Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Changes to be made: - Understand why is this guide separate from the guides? Is it because the guides in this section are split up into IdP type? If so that leave as be, else merge this guide into Enterprise IdP and change the name to allow for a “Login.
